name: Nature Demands an Offering
text: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses a creature you don't control and puts it on top of its owner's library, then repeats this process for an artifact, an enchantment, and a land. Then the owner of each permanent chosen this way shuffles his or her library.

name: Nature's Blessing
text: {G}{W}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature or that creature gains banding, first strike, or trample. (This effect lasts indefinitely. Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor:
"Be open to the blessings, whatever their form."
—Kaysa, elder druid of the Juniper Order

"Be open to the blessings, whatever their form."
 —Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Nature's Chosen
text:
Enchant creature you control
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.
Tap enchanted creature: Untap target artifact, creature, or land. Activate this ability only if enchanted creature is white and is untapped and only once each turn.

name: Nature's Claim
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Its controller gains 4 life.

editions.flavor:
"The timeless, tireless jaws of nature shall one day devour us all."
—Sildark, artificer of Omu

"On this plane, the use of magic can provoke a ferocious reprisal from nature. Whoever the Eldrazi were, their relics left Zendikar forever enraged."
—Jace Beleren

"The timeless, tireless jaws of nature shall one day devour us all."
—Sildark, artificer of Omu

name: Nature's Cloak
text: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

name: Nature Shields Its Own
text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
Whenever a creature attacks and isn't blocked, if you're the defending player, create a 0/1 green Plant creature token that's blocking that creature.
When four or more creatures attack you, abandon this scheme at end of combat.

name: Nature's Kiss
text:
Enchant creature
{1}, Exile the top card of your graveyard: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"I cradle my rage even as the earth cradles my dead kin."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Nature's Lore
text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Nature's secrets can be read on every tree, every branch, every leaf.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
editions.flavor: Nature's secrets can be read on every tree, every branch, every leaf.

"Fyndhorn is our home."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order

"It is in our nature to recognize beauty, but to repeat it—ah, that is another feat altogether."
—Hannah of Verdura
Nature's secrets can be read on every tree, every branch, every leaf.
Nature's secrets can be read on every tree, every branch, every leaf.

"Fyndhorn is our home."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us."
—Arathel, elvish queen
Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us.

name: Nature's Panoply
text:
Strive — Nature's Panoply costs {2}{G} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Choose any number of target creatures. Put a +1/+1 counter on each of them.

editions.flavor: Nature protects its own.

name: Nature's Resurgence
text: Each player draws a card for each creature card in his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
Spring follows winter
—Elvish expression meaning
"all things pass"

Spring follows winter
—Elvish expression meaning
"all things pass"

"The dead whisper to the living. If you listen, you will learn."
—Maro

name: Nature's Revolt
text: All lands are 2/2 creatures that are still lands.

editions.flavor:
"One day the land will don the semblance of flesh and challenge even the plowshare's blade."
—Oracle en-Vec
The land rises up to defend against those who would spoil its beauty.

name: Nature's Ruin
text: Destroy all green creatures.

editions.flavor: One chill blast—the exhalation of the grave.
One chill blast—the exhalation of the grave.

name: Nature's Spiral
text: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand. (A permanent card is an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker card.)

editions.flavor: Like nature, the fern spirals back on itself, eternally seeking its own center.
Snail shell, fern, tornado—the world connects all things in form.
Like nature, the fern spirals back on itself, eternally seeking its own center.

name: Nature's Way
text: Target creature you control gains vigilance and trample until end of turn. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.

editions.flavor: Many elves incorporate the beauty of nature into their inventions. Very few capture its savagery.

name: Nature's Will
text: Whenever one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, tap all lands that player controls and untap all lands you control.

editions.flavor:
"Without the kami to speak to nature on our behalf, we must beg help from nature directly."
—Seshiro the Anointed

name: Nature's Wrath
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Nature's Wrath unless you pay {G}.
Whenever a player puts an Island or blue permanent onto the battlefield, he or she sacrifices an Island or blue permanent.
Whenever a player puts a Swamp or black permanent onto the battlefield, he or she sacrifices a Swamp or black permanent.

name: Naughty
text: Search another target player's library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle that player's library.

name: Nausea
text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.
"Was it something I said?"
Any mogg will tell you there's nothing more nauseating than the smell of cute.
No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.

name: Nav Squad Commandos
text: Battalion — Whenever Nav Squad Commandos and at least two other creatures attack, Nav Squad Commandos gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Untap it.

editions.flavor: Funded by the Azorius to keep current maps of the undercity, the Boros nav squads survey even the most unsavory areas.

name: Naya
text:
You may play any number of lands on each of your turns.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, target red, green, or white creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each land you control.

name: Naya Battlemage
text:
{R}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor: "I have trained in all three schools of magic."

name: Naya Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Naya Charm deals 3 damage to target creature.
• Return target card from a graveyard to its owner's hand.
• Tap all creatures target player controls.

editions.flavor: Deep in nature's core lies a potential unsullied by greed or civilization.
Deep in nature's core lies a potential unsullied by greed or civilization.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: Deep in nature's core lies a potential unsullied by greed or civilization.

name: Naya Hushblade
text: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Naya Hushblade gets +1/+1 and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

name: Naya Panorama
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Naya Panorama: Search your library for a basic Mountain, Forest, or Plains card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Between the thunderous footfalls of Naya's behemoths lie moments of perfect quiet.
Between the thunderous footfalls of Naya's behemoths lie moments of perfect quiet.

name: Naya Sojourners
text:
When you cycle Naya Sojourners or it dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: The elves had entered a land like an open grave-an act of fortitude or folly?
The elves had entered a land like an open grave—an act of fortitude or folly?

name: Naya Soulbeast
text:
Trample
When you cast Naya Soulbeast, each player reveals the top card of his or her library. Naya Soulbeast enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the total converted mana cost of all cards revealed this way.

name: Near-Death Experience
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have exactly 1 life, you win the game.

editions.flavor: Lands ravaged, cities in ruins, so many lives sacrificed, and yet there was no other word for it but victory.
Lands ravaged, cities in ruins, so many lives sacrificed, and yet there was no other word for it but victory.

name: Nearheath Chaplain
text:
Lifelink
{2}{W}, Exile Nearheath Chaplain from your graveyard: Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Nearheath Pilgrim
text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Nearheath Pilgrim is paired with another creature, both creatures have lifelink.

name: Nearheath Stalker
text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: "Do not speak of this to the elders. They look unfavorably upon my indulgences."
"Do not speak of this to the elders. They look unfavorably upon my indulgences."

name: Nebelgast Herald
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
Whenever Nebelgast Herald or another Spirit enters the battlefield under your control, tap target creature an opponent controls.

name: Nebuchadnezzar
text: {X}, {T}: Name a card. Target opponent reveals X cards at random from his or her hand. Then that player discards all cards with that name revealed this way. Activate this ability only during your turn.

name: Neck Breaker
text:
Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0 and have trample.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Neck Breaker.

editions.flavor: He can't outrun what he is.

name: Neck Snap
text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor:
"We merrows need not be disadvantaged when fighting on land. We lack the vulnerability of those who breathe only through their throats."
—Minnarin, merrow reejerey

name: Necra Disciple
text:
{G}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor: "The darkness merely hides the light."

name: Necra Sanctuary
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a green or white permanent, target player loses 1 life. If you control a green permanent and a white permanent, that player loses 3 life instead.

name: Necratog
text: Exile the top creature card of your graveyard: Necratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The necratog can always dig up a meal.

name: Necravolver
text:
Kicker {1}{G} and/or {W} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} and/or {W} as you cast this spell.)
If Necravolver was kicked with its {1}{G} kicker, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with trample.
If Necravolver was kicked with its {W} kicker, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it and with "Whenever Necravolver deals damage, you gain that much life."

name: Necrite
text: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor: Necrites killed Jherana Rure, ending the counterinsurgency.
Necrites killed Jherana Rure, ending the counterinsurgency.
"Ever see a wall drop dead of fright, kid? It ain't pretty." —Cpl. Dobbs
Necrites killed Jherana Rure, ending the counter-insurgency.
Was it the sight, smell, or aura of the Necrite that killed so effectively?

name: Necrobite
text: Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. Regenerate it. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat. Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: An undead snake doesn't bite in self-defense. It hungers as any zombie, never sated.
A servant of Pharika must know countless balms that heal and soothe—and countless more that do the opposite.

name: Necrogen Censer
text:
Necrogen Censer enters the battlefield with two charge counters on it.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Necrogen Censer: Target player loses 2 life.

editions.flavor: Moriok necromancers actively spread necrogen, encouraging the transformation from Mirran to nim.

name: Necrogenesis
text: {2}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

editions.flavor:
"Those may be the squirms of one life ending or of another beginning. Either way, I'd leave it alone."
—Rakka Mar

"Those may be the squirms of one life ending or of another beginning. Either way, I'd leave it alone."
—Rakka Mar

"Those may be the squirms of one life ending or of another beginning. Either way, I'd leave it alone."
—Rakka Mar

"Those may be the squirms of one life ending or of another beginning. Either way, I'd leave it alone."
—Rakka Mar

name: Necrogen Mists
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player discards a card.

editions.flavor: Mephidross filled with roars of fury and wails of despair as the leonin fought to keep their memories from being pulled into the mists.

name: Necrogen Scudder
text:
Flying
When Necrogen Scudder enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.

editions.flavor: Contrary to popular belief, it's kept aloft by necrogen gas, not the screaming agony of a thousand murdered souls.
Contrary to popular belief, it's kept aloft by necrogen gas, not the screaming agony of a thousand murdered souls.

name: Necrogen Spellbomb
text:
{B}, Sacrifice Necrogen Spellbomb: Target player discards a card.
{1}, Sacrifice Necrogen Spellbomb: Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Forget that which was never known."
—Spellbomb inscription

name: Necro-Impotence
text:
Skip your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay X life. If you do, untap X permanents.
Pay ½ life: Remove the top card of your library from the game face down. Put that card into your hand at end of turn.

name: Necrologia
text:
Cast Necrologia only during your end step.
As an additional cost to cast Necrologia, pay X life.
Draw X cards.

editions.flavor:
"My enemies' death yields threefold benefit: removal, reuse, and research."
—Volrath

"My enemies' death yields threefold benefit: removal, reuse, and research."
—Volrath

name: Necromancer's Assistant
text: When Necromancer's Assistant enters the battlefield, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Zombies and necromancers agree: easy access to brains is preferred.

name: Necromancer's Covenant
text:
When Necromancer's Covenant enters the battlefield, exile all creature cards from target player's graveyard, then create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token for each card exiled this way.
Zombies you control have lifelink.

name: Necromancer's Magemark
text:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1.
If a creature you control that's enchanted would die, return it to its owner's hand instead.

name: Necromancer's Stockpile
text: {1}{B}, Discard a creature card: Draw a card. If the discarded card was a Zombie card, create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

editions.flavor: The experiments decided to perform some research of their own.

name: Necromancy
text:
You may cast Necromancy as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
When Necromancy enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Necromancy." Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control and attach Necromancy to it. When Necromancy leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.

name: Necromantic Selection
text: Destroy all creatures, then return a creature card put into a graveyard this way to the battlefield under your control. It's a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types. Exile Necromantic Selection.

editions.flavor: It shambled from the cloud of ash and bone dust, undeterred by its own extinction.

name: Necromantic Summons
text:
Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
Spell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, that creature enters the battlefield with two additional +1/+1 counters on it.

name: Necromantic Thirst
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Necromaster Dragon
text:
Flying
Whenever Necromaster Dragon deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token and each opponent puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

name: Necropede
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
When Necropede dies, you may put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

name: Necroplasm
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Necroplasm.
At the beginning of your end step, destroy each creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Necroplasm.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

name: Necropolis
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put X +0/+1 counters on Necropolis, where X is the exiled card's converted mana cost.

name: Necropolis Fiend
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Flying
{X}, {T}, Exile X cards from your graveyard: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

name: Necropolis Regent
text:
Flying
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, put that many +1/+1 counters on it.

editions.flavor: "Jarad fancies himself king of the undercity, but he's merely king of rot."

name: Necropotence
text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.

name: Necropotence Avatar
text:
Skip your draw step.
At the beginning of your end step, if it's not the first turn of the game, put a death counter on Necropotence Avatar. You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of death counters on Necropotence Avatar.

Necrosavant

name: Necroskitter
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever a creature an opponent controls with a -1/-1 counter on it dies, you may return that card to the battlefield under your control.

name: Necrotic Ooze
text: As long as Necrotic Ooze is on the battlefield, it has all activated abilities of all creature cards in all graveyards.

editions.flavor:
"To death all must go, and so in death lies ultimate power."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

name: Necrotic Plague
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature."
When enchanted creature dies, its controller chooses target creature one of his or her opponents controls. Return Necrotic Plague from its owner's graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.

name: Necrotic Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{3}, Sacrifice this permanent: Destroy target permanent."

editions.flavor: Though Volrath is long dead, the slivers have become everything he wanted them to be: mindless instruments of destruction and despair.
Though Volrath is long dead, the slivers have become everything he wanted them to be: mindless instruments of destruction and despair.

name: Nectar Faerie
text:
Flying
{B}, {T}: Target Faerie or Elf gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor:
"The unpredictable fae are just as likely to provide a blight as a boon."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

name: Need for Speed
text: Sacrifice a land: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: His feet buckled the ground, his hands cut the wind to ribbons, and he was gone.

name: Needlebite Trap
text:
If an opponent gained life this turn, you may pay {B} rather than pay Needlebite Trap's mana cost.
Target player loses 5 life and you gain 5 life.

editions.flavor: The traps around the vampire city of Malakir hint at the thirst of its inhabitants.

name: Needlebug
text:
Flash
Protection from artifacts

text:

text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

name: Nemesis Trap
text:
If a white creature is attacking, you may pay {B}{B} rather than pay Nemesis Trap's mana cost.
Exile target attacking creature. Create a token that's a copy of that creature. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Nephalia
text:
At the beginning of your end step, put the top seven cards of your library into your graveyard. Then return a card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Nephalia Academy
text:
If a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard a card, you may reveal that card and put it on top of your library instead of putting it anywhere else.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"May knowledge be our sanctuary."
—Yora, academy researcher

name: Nephalia Drownyard
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}{B}, {T}: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Some see a coastal disaster. I see a fully-stocked seagraf."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Nephalia Moondrakes
text:
Flying
When Nephalia Moondrakes enters the battlefield, target creature gains flying until end of turn.
{4}{U}{U}, Exile Nephalia Moondrakes from your graveyard: Creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.

name: Nephalia Seakite
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying

editions.flavor:
"Keep one eye on the cliff road or you may fall to your death. Keep one eye on the sky or your death may fall on you."
—Manfried Ulmach, Elgaud Master-at-Arms

"Keep one eye on the cliff road or you may fall to your death. Keep one eye on the sky or your death may fall on you."
—Manfried Ulmach, Elgaud Master-at-Arms

name: Nephalia Smuggler
text: {3}{U}, {T}: Exile another target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor: "My drivers are trustworthy. I removed their tongues myself. Any other questions?"
"My drivers are trustworthy. I removed their tongues myself. Any other questions?"
